ClassInfo.author: JEAF Development Team
ClassInfo.description: Class contains all generated constants for messages of JEAF's Persistence Service Provider.

Message.defaultText: Used transaction context implementation ''{0}'' is not an instance of ''{1}'' and thus not compatible with this peristence service provider implementation. This is probably a configuration problem.
Message.description: Exceptions with this error code are thrown if the available transaction context is incompatible with the one required by the implementation.
Message.name: UNSUPPORTED_TX_CONTEXT_IMPL

Message.defaultText: Trying to obtain pessimistic lock for session id.
Message.description: Messages with this message id are traced when the hibernate persistence service provider tries to obtain a lock for getting the next session id.
Message.name: OBTAINING_LOCK_FOR_SESSION_ID

Message.defaultText: Created object id generator using session id ''{0}''.
Message.description: Messages with this message id are traced when the hibernate persistence service provider created a new object id generator.
Message.name: CREATED_OBJECT_ID_GENERATOR

Message.defaultText: Lookup for entity manager with JNDI Name ''{0}'' failed.
Message.description: Exceptions with this error code are thrown if the lookup for an entity manager fails.
Message.name: LOOKUP_FOR_ENTITY_MANAGER_FAILED

Message.defaultText: The runtime environment ''{0}'' is not supported by this persistence service provider implementation.
Message.description: Exceptions with this error code are thrown if the persistence service provider implementation is used within an unsupported environment.
Message.name: UNSUPPORTED_RUNTIME

Message.defaultText: Query returned an empty result set although exactly one object was expected.
Message.description: Exceptions with this error code are thrown if a query for a single result returned an empty result set that but one object is required.
Message.name: EMPTY_RESULT_SET_NOT_ALLOWED

Message.defaultText: A query for a single result set returned more that one object. This may be an inconsistency within the database or a bug.
Message.description: Exceptions with this error code are thrown if a query for a single result returned more than one object.
Message.name: SINGLE_RESULT_QUERY_RETURNED_MANY_OBJECTS

Message.defaultText: Reading specific configuration for persistence unit ''{0}'' from its property file ''{0}.properties''.
Message.description: Messages with message id will be traced for every persistence unit whose configuration is read from its property file.
Message.name: USING_JPA_CONFIGURATION_FROM_PROPERTIES

Message.defaultText: Reading specific configuration for persistence unit ''{0}'' from persistence.xml.
Message.description: Messages with message id will be traced for every persistence unit whose configuration is read from persistence.xml.
Message.name: USING_JPA_CONFIGURATION_FROM_PERSISTENCE_XML

Message.defaultText: Object of class ''{0}'' with OID ''{1}'' could not be found.
Message.description: Exceptions with this error code are thrown if an object that was queried by its OID could not be found.
Message.name: OBJECT_DOES_NOT_EXIST

Message.defaultText: Trying to lookup entity manager with JNDI path ''{0}''
Message.description: Messages with this id will be traced when JEAF tries to lookup an an entity manager.
Message.name: LOOKING_UP_ENTITY_MANAGER

Message.defaultText: The value ''{0}'' as ClassID is already in use by class ''{1}''.
Message.description: Exceptions with this error code are thrown if the class id value is already in use.
Message.name: CLASS_ID_VALUE_ALREADY_IN_USE

Message.defaultText: The class ''{0}'' is already assigned to class id ''{1}'' (Int-Value: ''{2}'').
Message.description: Exceptions with this error code are thrown if the class is already assigned to a class id.
Message.name: CLASS_ALREADY_IN_USE

Message.defaultText: Determined optimistic lock conflict for object of class ''{0}'' with OID ''{1}''. Expected version ''{2}'' but loaded version ''{3}'' from database.
Message.description: Exceptions with this error code are thrown if an object optimistic lock conflict is detected when loading an object from the database.
Message.name: OPTIMISTIC_LOCK_CONFLICT

Message.defaultText: Entity Manager JNDI Name is not configured for persistence unit definition ''{0}''. Please ensure that the persistence unit ''{0}'' has set attribute 'entityManagerJNDI' in UML model.
Message.description: Exceptions with this error code are thrown if no entity manager JNDI name is defined in the UML model.
Message.name: ENTITY_MANAGER_JNDI_NOT_DEFINED

Message.defaultText: Query execution took {0}ms and found {1} object(s).
Message.description: Messages with the messages id are written when an explicit query returns.
Message.name: QUERY_COMPLETED

Message.defaultText: Flushing of persistence context took {0}ms.
Message.description: Messages with the messages id are written when the current persistence contexted is flushed.
Message.name: FLUSHED_CONTEXT

Message.defaultText: Query updated {0} objects in {1}ms.
Message.description: Messages with the messages id are written when an update query is executed.
Message.name: EXECUTED_UPDATE_QUERY

Message.defaultText: @PersistenceConfig annotation of class {0} declares that class {1} has annotation @{2}. However the class does not have this annotation. Please correct the configuration of the persistence unit.
Message.description: Exceptions with the error code are thrown if a persistence unit configuration contains an invalid reference for container manager connections.
Message.name: INVALID_REF_IN_PERSISTENCE_CONFIG

Message.defaultText: Class {0} does not have annotation @PersistenceConfig. Please correct your configuration.
Message.description: Exceptions with the error code are thrown if JEAF Persistence configuration file points to a class that does not have annotation @PersistenceConfig.
Message.name: CLASS_DOES_NOT_DECLARE_PERSISTENCE_CONFIG

Message.defaultText: @PersistenceUnit ''{0}'' declares that class {1} has annotation @{2}. However the class does not have this annotation. Please correct the configuration of the persistence unit.
Message.description: Exceptions with the error code are thrown if a persistence unit configuration contains an invalid reference for container manager connections.
Message.name: INVALID_REF_IN_PERSISTENCE_UNIT

Message.defaultText: Invalid configuration for container managed connections. Annotation {0} of class ''{1}'' defines a JTA AND a non-JTA datasource. You either have to define a JTA or a non-JTA datasource for a container managed persistence unit but not both.
Message.description: Exceptions with the error code are thrown if a persistence unit configuration defines a JTA and a non-JTA datasource.
Message.name: JTA_AND_NON_JTA_DATASOURCE_DEFINED

Message.defaultText: Invalid configuration for container managed connections. Annotation {0} of class ''{1}'' defines neither a JTA AND nor a non-JTA datasource. You either have to define a JTA or a non-JTA datasource for a container managed persistence unit but not none.
Message.description: Exceptions with the error code are thrown if a persistence unit configuration neither defines a JTA nor a non-JTA datasource.
Message.name: NO_DATASOURCE_DEFINED

Message.defaultText: Invalid persistence configuration in class ''{0}''. Neither container managed connections nor application managed connections are defined.
Message.description: Exceptions with the error code are thrown if a persistence configuration neither defines container nor application managed connections.
Message.name: NO_CONNECTIONS_DEFINED

Message.defaultText: Invalid persistence unit ''{0}''. Classes of persistence unit are not defined at all. Neither as JAR files, nor as managed classes nor through mapping files.
Message.description: Exceptions with the error code are thrown if a persistence unit configuration does not define persistent classes at all.
Message.name: NO_PERSISTENT_CLASSES

Message.defaultText: Invalid JDBC connection URL defined in @{0} annotation of class {1}. Please correct your configuration.
Message.description: Exceptions with the error code are thrown if a application managed connections configuration does not have real string as JDBC connection URL.
Message.name: JDBC_CONNECTION_URL_MISSING

Message.defaultText: JNDI Lookup for datasource ''{0}'' failed. Details: {1}
Message.description: Exceptions with the error code are thrown if a application managed connections configuration does not have real string as JDBC connection URL.
Message.name: DATASOURCE_LOOKUP_FAILED

Message.defaultText: Unable to create new entiy manager for persistence unit ''{0}''. Persistence unit is not known.
Message.description: Exceptions with the error code are thrown if a a new entity manager could not be created.
Message.name: PERSISTENCE_UNIT_NOT_DEFINED
